background: A scientist has two experiments, alpha and beta, that produce electricity by consuming metal and acid resources. The scientist aims to maximize electricity production within the available amounts of metal and acid.
constraints: Number of alpha experiments is non-negative
Number of beta experiments is non-negative
Metal consumed by alpha and beta experiments is less than or equal to TotalMetal
Acid consumed by alpha and beta experiments is less than or equal to TotalAcid
objective: Maximize the total amount of electricity produced by conducting alpha and beta experiments
description: A scientist is conducting two experiments to produce electricity, experiment alpha and experiment beta. In experiment alpha, \param{MetalAlpha} units of metal and \param{AcidAlpha} units of acid are required to produce \param{ElectricityAlpha} units of electricity. In experiment beta, \param{MetalBeta} units of metal and \param{AcidBeta} units of acid are required to produced \param{ElectricityBeta} units of electricity. The lab has \param{TotalMetal} units of metal and \param{TotalAcid} units of acid available. How many of each experiment should the scientist conduct to maximize the total amount of electricity produced?
